Now, the code outline:

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, ans, N, c, current_i, next_i

   integer, allocatable :: arr(:)

   ! First step: read input and compute ans

   read(*,*) n

   allocate(arr(0:n-1))

   read(*,*) arr

   ans = arr(0) +1

   integer :: i

   do i =1, n-1

      ans = ans + abs(arr(i) - arr(i-1)) +2

   end do

   ! Second step: compute c using ans as N

   N = ans

   c =0

   current_i =357

   do while (current_i <= N)

      if (has_all_digits(current_i)) then

         c = c +1

      end if

      ! compute next_i

      character(len=20) :: s, new_str, reversed_str

      logical :: f

      write(s, '(i0)') current_i

      integer :: len_s = len_trim(s) new_str = '' f = .false.

      integer :: j

      do j =1, len_s

         character(len=1) :: current_char

         current_char = s(len_s -j +1 : len_s -j +1)

         if (.not. f) then

            if (current_char == '3') then

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '5'

               f = .true.

            else if (current_char == '5') then

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '7'

               f = .true.

            else

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '3'

            end if

         else

            new_str = trim(new_str) //
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
current_char

         end if

      end do

      if (.not. f) then

         new_str = trim(new_str) // '3'

      end if

      ! reverse new_str to get next_i's string

      reversed_str = ''

      integer :: k

      do k = len_trim(new_str), 1, -1

         reversed_str = trim(reversed_str) // new_str(k:k)

      end do

      read(reversed_str, *) next_i

      current_i = next_i

   end do

   ! Third step: compute result from c

   integer :: result

   result = (c /3)*2 + merge(1,0, mod(c,3) /=0)

   write(*,*) result

contains

   logical function has_all_digits(n)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      character(len=20) :: s

      logical :: has3, has5, has7

      write(s, '(i0)') n

      has3 = .false. has5 = .false.

      has7 = .false.

      integer : : i

      do i =1, len_trim(s)

         character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i)

         if (c == '3') has3 = .true. if (c == '5') has5 = .true. if (c == '7') has7 = .true.

      end do

      has_all_digits = has3 .and. has5 .and.

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, ans, N, c, current_i, next_i

   integer, allocatable :: arr(:)

   ! First step: read input and compute ans

   read(*,*) n

   allocate(arr(0:n-1))

   read(*,*) arr

   ans = arr(0) +1

   integer :: i

   do i =1, n-1

      ans = ans + abs(arr(i) - arr(i-1)) +2

   end do

   ! Second step: compute c using ans as N

   N = ans

   c =0

   current_i =357

   do while (current_i <= N)

      if (has_all_digits(current_i)) then

         c = c +1

      end if

      ! compute next_i

      character(len=20) :: s, new_str, reversed_str

      logical :: f

      write(s, '(i0)') current_i

      integer :: len_s = len_trim(s)

      new_str = ''

      f = .false.

      integer :: j

      do j =1, len_s

         character(len=1) :: current_char

         current_char = s(len_s -j +1 : len_s -j +1)

         if (.not. f) then

            if (current_char == '3') then

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '5'

               f = .true.

            else if (current_char == '5') then

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '7'

               f = .true.

            else

               new_str = trim(new_str) // '3'

      end do

      if (.not. f) then

         new_str = trim(new_str) // '3'

      end if

      ! reverse new_str to get next_i's string

      reversed_str = ''

      integer :: k

      do k = len_trim(new_str), 1, -1

         reversed_str = trim(reversed_str) // new_str(k:k)

      end do

      read(reversed_str, *) next_i

      current_i = next_i

   end do

   ! Third step: compute result from c

   integer :: result

   result = (c /3)*2 + merge(1,0, mod(c,3) /=0)

   write(*,*) result

contains

   logical function has_all_digits(n)

      integer, intent(in) :: n
